Text: The Blu-rays are a long way off yet.  Can anyone confirm if these are real?

DEFINITELY NOT Blu-Ray rips.  

Raiders has an channel logo pop-up on occasion plus there is Asian sub-titles.  Watch the opening scene in the Amazon when the year is displayed in English and an Asian characterset, possibly Japanese.  My guess is these are Japanese HDTV rips.  

Incidentally, the audio sounds very much like the track on Raiders is from the DVD release but has been nicely synched to the HDTV rip.
The fourth episode is Blu-Ray of course :)  Quality of the fourth one is very good, in fact I'd replace my 4Gb rip with it to save some storage space.

This is not 720p (only 544): "The number 720 stands for the 720 horizontal scan lines of display resolution (also known as 720 pixels of vertical resolution)"  -- https://secure.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/wiki/720p

People used to get this right. But not lately.

For eveyone having problems with sound: In VLC, change the audio output from 5.1 or stereo to MONO. This is the only way the audio tracks will layer correctly.

Also, not Bluray but pretty damn clear.

Quality: 10/10 for both sound and video.

I've seen these films countless times on every medium imaginable: VHS, Laserdisc, DVD and various TV broadcasts. These rips are hands-down the best I've seen. I assume they were pulled from a broadcaster that obtained the full-res versions of the mints used for the DVD releases. Not full 1080 and not a new master, but by far the best out there. Fantastic work all around, plays smoothly on my PS3 and looks great on my HDTV.
